issue.title: [FCD] Accidental move-only library types due to new core language rules

discussion.p: With the final acceptance of move operations as special members and introduction of corresponding suppression rules of implicitly generated copy operations the some library types that were copyable in C++03 are no longer copyable (only movable) in C++03, among them queue, priority_queue, and stack.

The only open issue in CH 15 with respect to the concurrency group was the treatment of atomic_future. Since we removed atomic_future in Batavia, I think all that remains is to remove the open issue from N3112 and adopt it.
